alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Lorain; Medina; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 9:56PM EDT until August 24 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland and Lorain. In northeast Ohio, Medina and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 956 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Medina, Wooster, Wadsworth, Orrville, Rittman, Wellington, Doylestown, Lodi, Creston, Dalton, West Salem, Chippewa Lake, Savannah, Polk, Norton, Sullivan, Seville, Penfield, Smithville and Apple Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
